title: Thomas Baroukh
text: Thomas Baroukh (born 15 December 1987) is a French <a href="Rowing%20%28sport%29">rower</a>. He competed in the <a href="Rowing%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20lightweight%20coxless%20four">Men's lightweight coxless four</a> event at the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Olympics">2012 Summer Olympics</a>, finishing in 7th. At the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Olympics</a>, he was part of the French lightweight coxless four that won the bronze medal. The same team, consisting of Baroukh, <a href="Franck%20Solforosi">Franck Solforosi</a>, <a href="Guillaume%20Raineau">Guillaume Raineau</a> and <a href="Thibault%20Colard">Thibault Colard</a>, also won the bronze medal at the <a href="2015%20World%20Rowing%20Championships">2015 World Rowing Championships</a> and bronze at the <a href="2015%20European%20Rowing%20Championships">2015 European Rowing Championships</a>. Baroukh's previous team, which included Solforosi, Raineau and Augustin Mouterde won the bronze at the <a href="2013%20European%20Rowing%20Championships">2013</a> and <a href="2014%20European%20Rowing%20Championships">2014 European Championships</a>. Baroukh and Mouterde won the silver medal in the men's lightweight pair at the <a href="2014%20World%20Rowing%20Championships">2014 World Rowing Championships</a>.
